reviews.text: Impressive part of Lithuanian Grand Duchy history. :) Chapel was built in 1326 as part of Lublin Castle complex. In 1407 it was rebuilt in Gothic style by Lithuanian grand duke and Polish king Jogaila. Extensive fresco work was conducted in the interior by an anonymous team of Ruthenian painters under the supervision of Master Andrey. It was during this time that the walls and ceiling were covered in a Rutheno-Byzantine polychrome. The paintings were completed in 1418, which is noted in Cyrillic on the patronage tablet, located on the arch between the nave and the presbytery of the church. Along with religious scenes decorating the interior of the church, there are two portraits of Jogaila, the patron of the painting project. The polychrome was conducted with various techniques: both on dry and wet plaster with tempera paint. So, it is very sensitive and protected area. :)
A must-see place in Lublin.
They gave us specific times on the ticket which hadn't been discussed and was awkward to change, but otherwise good
Small and has nothing in it but a tiny table at the back. If you're not religious'y, there's not much point in going.
must see!

Incredible theater and museum serving as a continuing and historic gateway between past and present, Jewish and Polish. Performances based partly on the vital work being accomplished by the cultural center, which is slowly recovering information on the thousands of Jews who once made Lublin the powerful regional and European community it was - and, differently composed, remains. Part museum, part theater, part school, part archive. An important way to learn and honor the city’s traditions and tragedies. A must see experience. Contemporary exhibits in thoughtfully planned layout. Living history.
Amazing people. Doing great job on commoration
Amazing place of culture and wisdom. Pure pleasure
A one of a kind place, hard to describe in words. It combines a museum, research institute, place to get advice for Jewish sites in the area and a theatre. Very interesting and educational.
You enter the old town here, sets you right in the mood

It was quite windy the day we went but it is worth visiting both the camp and the small presentations and museum inside.
The way they have the exposition distributed really helps to get things into perspective.
The declarations of the testimonies in the museum do really make an impact...

A very sad, but genuine experience. It's less popular than Auschwitz, so I was almost alone, facing this very shameful moment of the history of humanity, when the Nazis decided to exterminate people who they believed not to be equal to them. In this quite humble place, after seeing that nightmare, I found some kind of inner peace. Let the history never repeat.

Its a cool experience to visit the concentration camp. I recommend to visit it with a guide, because if not you only read the signs like in history books. Entrance is for free which is really nice and map is not necessary. I suggest to plan it for one hour and a half or two hours!
Great museum, a lot of things to read.

Very moving place to visit. Nevertheless the place is well looked after and clean, in the customer centre, reading materials can be purchased in many languages, there's also loads of parking which is very cheap. Everything is displayed where it need to be and sometimes in multiple languages. I've managed to attach myself to a tour, and the guide explained everything in detail, took us about 3hrs. The middle museum holds artefacts found on the grounds, as well as letters, documents, furniture, equipment, and statues made by prisoners. The remembererance monument is one of the biggest I've seen and really makes an impact. At the end crematorium, human ashes pile and executions trenches can also be visited. Definitely worth a visit so that one human can know what another is capable of...

A small but really well run museum - hard to find - you have to walk through a building, into the courtyard of a cafe, and then you'll see the signs pointing down some stairs. Knowledgeable guide, with lots of interactive displays in English. You won't be blown away, but it is interesting.
Small, but interesting
Bardzo miła obsługa. Krótka i rzeczowa wycieczka ;)

Bardzo miła obsługa na 5 gwiazdek. Pani pięknie opowiedziała historię jednej jedynej piwnicy do której można było wejść. Ale szkoda że na stronie czy przed wejściem nie ma kompletnie żadnej informacji że z całej trasy dostępna jest tylko jedna jedyna mała piwnica. Zwiedzania na 5 min. Mieliśmy pecha.

מקום נוראי עם אנשים נוראים!!!!! לא להתקרב!!!!
המקום סגור (עולם אחד פטוח) כול האחרים סגורים ואתם מגלים על זה רק אחרי ששילמתם את הכסף. אין שום שלטים שאומרים שסגור.
ממש לא מומלץ!!! גם בחדר היחיד שפטוח אין שום דבר לראות!!!
Very nice and cheap
Good and affordable place to have a meal
Good food with low prices
I used to come here everyday when I was an exchange student in Lublin. Decent food.
Good traditional food. Economic
Tasty and reasonably priced Polish food (also burgers, but I did not have them).  They also have a good breakfast selection.  The chicken soup is very good.

The restaurant was located underground in a medieval building with many dark corridors. Definitely a must visit for its atmosphere. The food, carrot soup, chicken and potatoes and dessert was a fruit bowl, were excellent. Correct portions, not too much and not too little. Flavours were balanced very well. Overall an enjoyable meal with a fantastic atmosphere.

Drop dead gorgeous is a good way to describe this place. 

With a medieval styled area surrounding the restaurant it was easy to see why the restaurant had a very old and classy feel to it. Situated underground, the low lighting at first created a sense of mystery, but then once you are seated, you'll see plenty of brightly lit candles surrounding the dark room. Just like a candlelight dinner, you might even be disorientated, having lunch while thinking it's dinner. Brilliantly designed walls with small paintings of various royal people from the medieval era hanged on the walls.

Food came in fast and fresh. On the top of the ice-cold water with an essence of orange, a main course of fish and a small fruit platter was served. The water tasted brilliant, fish was cooked to perfection and the fruits were perfectly balanced with whipped cream as a topping. 

Service was friendly and quick, considering only 2 waiters served about 30 over guests.

This restaurant is definitely a place to eat at while staying here in Lublin. Very professional yet still retaining its medieval feel to it, a meal here will definitely give a lasting memory.
Very well priced selection of polish and sesonal cusine. Location is great, service is fun. I dine there everytime I visit Lublin.
Very slow waitress
Good location. Rustic and authentic. Excellent traditional polish food and local beer. The staff was friendly and helpful. Pierogi was fantastic ;) you must try!
Very good restaurant. If you want to try traditional polish food I would recommend it.

Excellent food and spotless service. Wanted only some Polish food, but we've received in the most charming folklore style. Next time we come to Lublin, we will definitely come back to this lovely resto.
I loved the soup but they had very few things left by the time we arrived. They could have informed us when we went in. Other than that the place is very beautiful and the service is correct

Excellent service, authentic menu with regional specials, seasonal options, fun coffee and drink choices. Can’t beat the location and atmosphere. Always full of locals and busy - for good reason. One of a few places in the square you must try. Plan accordingly!

High quality hotel placed in a historical and only partially renovated Lublin district. The building itself is a 16th century town house brought to a modern standard. Attentive service makes sure you have everything you need.
Stylish , comfortable in an old city area .
Rooms outstanding. We were in best room available. Level was like in 5 stars Four seasons in Manhattan.
Friendly service. They spoke English. Good gentle massage.

Excellent hotel
Perfect location
Excellent food
Amazing rooms
Outstanding service
It is highly recommended.
A small drawback, the pool is not heated enough
